This category lists all instances of [[work]]. Some of these have a page that only represents work level. Some have a page that represents the work and its only [[Book (major edition)|major edition]].
[[Category:Groups]]

{{#default_form:Work}}
This category only includes works that have more than one version and so are represented by a page with only a work. For works that have only one version which is a book, work is combined with edition in [[Form:Book]] and [[Template:Book]].
For a list of all Works, whether they are represented by their own pages or on the same page as an edition, see [[:Category:Works]].
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the person or organization that a manuscript document was addressed to. It is typically used for:
* letters * petitions * warrants * account books that were submitted to a committee
This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year in which a [[thesis]] was complete.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It identifies the person or organization that created a manuscript or collection of manuscripts.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the calendar year in which an author died. This is needed to calculate copyright terms. It is entered as a number, not a date, and should not have a calendar code after it.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] ends. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a person ID at [http://www.sixdegreesoffrancisbacon.com/ Six Degrees of Francis Bacon]. Only the ID number should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.sixdegreesoffrancisbacon.com/?ids=$1&min_confidence=60&type=network]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an Amazon Standard Identification Number used to identify products at Amazon. Only the ID number should be entered in this property. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/$1/]]
You should not create links to Amazon on this wiki without using this property.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a UIN code from the [http://explore.bl.uk/ British Library Main Catalogue]. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://explore.bl.uk/BLVU1:LSCOP-ALL:$1]]
It is usually used for books published in the UK between 1800 (the end of the ESTC) and 1950 (the start of the BNB). It can also be used for books published after 1950 if they are not yet in the BNB Linked Open Data and do not have an ISBN.
Similar to Wikidata property [[Wikidata:Property:P5199|P5199]] but formatted slightly differently.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents an ID number that forms part of the URI of a record for a book in the [http://bnb.data.bl.uk/ British National Bibliography as Linked Open Data]. This is the number that forms the last part of the web address (URI), '''not''' the 'BNB number' shown in the first row of the table. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://bnb.data.bl.uk/doc/resource/$1]]
This property is usually only used for books published in the UK between 1950 (the start of the BNB) and 1970 (after which ISBNs are preferred if available).
It can only be used for a publication. We do not currently link directly to author IDs in the BNB LOD.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a location ID at the [https://theclergydatabase.org.uk/ Clergy of the Church of England Database]. These locations are ecclesiastical areas such as parishes and dioceses. Only the item ID (usually one or more digits) should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://theclergydatabase.org.uk/jsp/locations/index.jsp?locKey=$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a Digital Object Identifier, which is typically used to refer to a journal article or thesis. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://DOI.org/$1]]
The DOI for the version of record should only be used for that version. A self-archived article either has its own DOI or no DOI.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a person ID at [http://emlo.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/ Early Modern Letters Online]. Only the ID should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://emlo.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/profile/person/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a citation number at the [http://ESTC.bl.uk/ English Short Title Catalogue]. Only the value of ESTC Citation No. ('''not''' ESTC, System No.) should be entered. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://ESTC.bl.uk/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It identifies a thesis at EThOS (the British Library's e-theses online service). It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://ethos.bl.uk/OrderDetails.do?uin=$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID at [http://www.geonames.org/ Geonames]. This is used in addition to Wikidata IDs because Geonames tends to make a more rigorous distinction between populated places and administrative units, whereas Wikidata sometimes conflates both into one entity which has two Geonames IDs. You should only enter the ID number here, not the full URL, or the html page appended to the ID number. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.geonames.org/$1/]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents an International Standard Book Number. It can accept either ISBN 10 or ISBN 13 numbers, but it should only have one value. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:BookSources/$1]]
This links to a special page at Wikidata where you can find links to search for the book in library catalogues and online booksellers.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It is used to link to copies of articles at [https://www.jstor.org/ JSTOR]. These copies are treated as the same as the version of record and are not represented by a separate wiki page.
Only the article ID should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.jstor.org/stable/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a page name at the [[MarineLives:MarineLives|Marine Lives wiki]]. Only the page name should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.marinelives.org/wiki/$1]]
You should only use this property for Marine Lives pages that correspond to the same entity whose page here the property is used on. You can also use interwiki links in free text to link to any Marine Lives page by using the prefix 'marinelives:'. For example, if you type <nowiki>[[marinelives:HCA 13/53]]</nowiki> it will be displayed as [[marinelives:HCA 13/53]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID from Ordnance Survey OpenNames. This is used for settlements in Great Britain in addition to other identifiers because OS data has the most complete and reliable coverage. It should be left blank for settlements outside Great Britain.
[[External formatter uri::http://data.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/id/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It refers to ID numbers at the [https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/ Scotland, Scandinavia and Northern European Biographical Database (SSNE)]. The value entered should be the number only. This is found at:
* the end of the URL of a person's page, such as <nowiki>https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/item.php?id=</nowiki>'''8049''' * in square brackets at the top of a person's page after their name, such as <nowiki>[SSNE 8049]</nowiki>
It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/item.php?id=$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::URL]]. It is used for:
* [[article]] if the official version of record is available online and has a URL but not a DOI. * [[book (minor edition)]] to link to a page for this edition at the publisher's website, where you may be able to buy a copy. It should '''not''' be used to link to any other retailer. For Amazon links, use [[Property:Has ASIN]]. To link to any other retailer, use free text in the 'Find copies elsewhere' section of a book's page.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a catalogue number at the [https://www.ustc.ac.uk/ Universal Short Title Catalogue]. Only the value of 'USTC REFERENCE NO' should be entered.
It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://ustc.ac.uk/index.php/record/$1]]

page.title: Property:Has Vision of Britain unit ID

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Property:Has Vision of Britain unit id]] to [[Property:Has Vision of Britain unit ID]]: case
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a unit ID at [http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/ Vision of Britain]. Only the ID number should be entered in this property. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/unit/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Geographic coordinates]]. It records a geographic point that roughly corresponds to the location of an Address or [[combat event]].
Coordinates are assumed to use the WGS84 system, which is the system for geographic coordinates used by Google Maps, Geonames, Open Street Map, Wikidata and many others but is different from the Ordnance Survey National Grid. ETRS89 geodetic coordinates are near enough that they can be entered here but the software will treat them as WGS84 afterwards.
Latitude comes first, and longitude second, separated by a comma. You can enter the values as decimal degrees or as degrees, minutes and seconds. They are automatically displayed on the page as degrees, minutes and seconds.

revision.comment: what to do if Wikidata conflates settlement and parish
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an item ID at [[Wikidata:Main_Page|Wikidata]]. Only the item ID (usually starting with Q and followed by a series of digits) should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/entity/$1]]
There should be an exact one to one correspondence for people and animals, but other entity types might only be an approximate match because of differences between how By The Sword Linked and Wikidata define entities or because of inconsistencies within Wikidata.
Where a Wikidata item covers a settlement and a parish at the same time, we use it only to refer to the settlement.

revision.comment: changed link to templates that use this property
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by [[Template:Agent event subobject]] and [[Template:Unit event subobject]] to show which side an Agent or Unit was in a [[combat event]].
Allows multiple values because a person or unit could change sides during a battle or siege.
Possible values are listed in [[:Category:Allegiance factions]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents a person or organization that was an author of a [[book (major edition)]], [[article]] or [[thesis]].
For manuscript texts, use [[Property:Created by]] instead.

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Property:Has full reference]] to [[Property:Has citable reference]]
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. You can use it to enter the full catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) used to cite a manuscript, including folio numbers if any. This does not have to be a volume that can be ordered individually. For the reference used to order a document, use [[Property:Has orderable reference]]. If a collection within an archive's catalogue hierarchy does not have a corresponding catalogue reference, please put 'See lower levels' here.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It represents a unique identifier of an individual [[printed copy]] in a library catalogue. It is not linked to as an external identifier because different library catalogues have different formats for identifiers, and not all have online resolvers. The ID entered here may be different from the URL in [[Property:Has official catalogue record]].
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the current copyright status of the original text of a source. Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Copyright status]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the actual end date of an entity if the actual end date is definitely known. It is used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
Values for this property are usually also automatically assigned to [[Property:Has latest known date]].
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the actual start date of an entity if the actual start date is definitely known. It is used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
Values for this property are usually also automatically assigned to [[Property:Has earliest known date]].
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It contains a short, human-readable description of an entity or source. This is usually displayed at the top of the page to help with disambiguation in the same way as the Wikipedia template [[Wikipedia:Template:About|about]]. It can also be displayed in query results.
Try to use as little wiki markup as possible in the description. Make the text as short as possible but do include all of an entities names and titles as this makes it easier to search for them.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the first date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact start date is known, use [[Property:Has definite start date|Has definite start date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents a person who edited [[book (major edition)]] or [[article]]. It can also include translators.

revision.comment: changed link to templates that use this property
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by [[Template:Agent event subobject]] and [[Template:Unit event subobject]] to link to the event that an Agent or Unit participated in.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the gender of a historical person or animal. For the purposes of this site, gender is represented as an external social status. It should not be assumed that this matches a person's biological sex or preferred gender identity, neither of which are easy to discover for early-modern people. A person's gender status can be classed as 'confirmed' or 'assumed' depending on the strength of evidence from primary sources. Many early-modern people cannot be strongly confirmed as male or female.
Values are listed in [[:Category:Genders]]. Note that humans and animals have different gender statuses.
More genders can be added in future if needed. The property can take multiple values in case a person had more than one gender status. Female soldiers or sailors who passed as men will be classed as male and female.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the issue number of the journal issue that an [[article]] was published in. For volume number, use [[Property:Has volume number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the last date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact end date is known, use [[Property:Has definite end date|Has definite end date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the licence conditions of the original text of a source. Images of unpublished manuscripts may have different conditions from the text.
Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Licence conditions]], and more will be added in future to cover all possible Creative Commons licences.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It links to the main subjects of a source. You should only include an entity as a main subject if the source is wholly or mainly about that entity. You can include multiple subjects for the same source, but try to use as few as possible.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents an Agent who was a member of an Area or Unit, or resident of an Address.

This is a property of type [[Has type::URL]]. It is used for the web address (URL) of the official catalogue record of a manuscript collection or text. If a collection or text doesn't correspond to any particular catalogue record, or if the archive doesn't have an online catalogue, just leave this blank.
This is a property of type [[Has type::URL]]. It is used for the official website of a [[GLAM]] or a [[serial publication]]. You should paste in the whole address, including the http:// at the start.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It shows the catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) that can be used to order a manuscript text or collection in the archive that holds it. If a text or collection is at a lower level than a volume that can be ordered, put the lowest level that can be ordered here. The full reference used to cite it goes in [[Property:Has citable reference]]. If the collection is at a higher level than anything that can be ordered individually, please enter 'See lower levels'.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents the Address, Area or Unit that an Agent was a member of.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that one entity is a parent of another. The exact meaning depends on the context.
Note that it never represents:
* a relationship between two people as this is outside the scope of this project. * a relationship between copies, editions and works. For this, use [[Property:Is version of]] instead.
== Command relationships ==
It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the parent in the relationship. Depending on the relationship type, this may be an ancestor rather than an immediate parent.
Where the child unit is an address and [[Property:Has role|relationship type]] is [[military occupation]], the parent should have two values: one should be an [[:Category:Allegiance factions|allegiance faction]], and the other the specific unit which occupied the place. This is to make it easier to generate maps of territory controlled by factions.
== Collections, manuscript texts, and printed copies ==
It shows a source's immediate parent in the hierarchy of the archive that holds it.
* the parent of a collection can be another collection or a GLAM * the parent of a manuscript text can be another manuscript text, a collection, or sometimes a GLAM * the parent of an early printed copy can be a collection or a GLAM * the parent of a text section is the manuscript text or printed copy that it's part of, or another section if the text has a more complicated structure
== Event ==
It shows that one event was part of another, such as:
* an assault or sally that was part of a siege. * a battle or skirmish that was part of a bigger raid. For example, the battle of Chalgrove was part of the raid on Chinnor but was a distinct part of it that needs a page in its own right. * a battle or capture of a fort that was part of a bigger series of battles, such as the individual parts of the battles of Lostwithiel. * a meeting that happened on one day but was part of a longer session

revision.comment: changed link to templates that use this property
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by [[Template:Agent event subobject]] and [[Template:Unit event subobject]] to link to an Agent or Unit that participated in an event.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the place where a published edition was published. Values are taken from [[:Category:Addresses]]. This is only used in extra properties for printed sources published in the mid-17th century.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year of publication of a book (minor edition) as stated on the title page or in a catalogue record. It is not stored as a date and does not make any claims about which calendar is used.
This property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons if an edition consists of multiple volumes that were published in different years.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the result of a siege.
The allowed values for this property are listed in [[:Category:Siege results]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents the rank or position that a person held in an organization.
Values are listed in [[:Category:Personnel roles]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the subordinate in the relationship.
The value of this property is usually set automatically by a template so it doesn't have to be entered.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It represents the full title of a [[book (major edition)]], [[article]] or [[thesis]]. It is '''not''' split into main title and subtitle.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used in [[Form:Book]] and [[Template:Book]] when a book does not yet have a known external identifier. This property should usually have the default value [[Unknown]]. This makes it easier to find books that are missing an external identifier.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]].
For [[article]]s published in a journal, it represents the volume number of the journal volume that an article was published in. For issue number, use [[Property:Has issue number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered. A volume typically covers one year, but this could vary. A journal article should usually have only one volume number.
For a [[book (major edition)]] that is part of a series, this property represents the volume number within the series. It is represented at the level of major editions, not minor editions. If the edition has multiple volumes, the property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons, each one giving the number of a volume. For example, I.G. Philip's edition of ''The Journal of Sir Samuel Luke'' published by Oxfordshire Record Society, would have these values:
29;31;33
We do not record volume numbers for a book that has more than one volume but is not part of a series (for example, Warburton's ''Memoirs of Prince Rupert and the Cavaliers''). This information can usually be found in external resources linked to by external identifiers. In some cases, volumes of a book may need to be represented as different major or minor editions.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which [[GLAM]] holds a collection, manuscript text, early printed copy, or text section. This is a direct relationship between each item and its GLAM, separate from the hierarchy represented with [[Property:Has parent]]. The GLAM name qualifies the references given in [[Property:Has orderable reference]] and [[Property:Has citable reference]].
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It defines the type of entity that a page represents.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects that represent a temporary location in [[Template:Location subobject]]. It refers to the unit or agent whose location is represented. The value is always set automatically by the template.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which manuscript or printed text a section ultimately belongs to. This is not always the same as the value of [[Property:Has parent]]. The value of '''is section of''' should never be another section, only a manuscript text or printed copy.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a printed or manuscript text is a copy or edition of an edition or work. It is used to link:
* a manuscript copy to a [[work]] * a [[printed copy]] to a [[book (minor edition)|minor edition]] * a [[book (minor edition)|minor edition]] to a [[book (major edition)|major edition]] * a [[book (major edition)|major edition]] to a [[work]]
It may also be used to link directly to ancestor levels as well as to immediate parents. To make sure that queries act as expected, it's best to also query for [[Property:Is instance of]] so that you can specify copy, major edition or minor edition.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the approximate location of an entity in relation to an address. 'Located in or near' means that the location is deliberately kept vague because 17th-century sources don't always allow us to be more specific. It is used by:
* Events ([[Template:Event]]) * Addresses ([[Template:Address]]) if the address is a [[building]], [[street], or [[bridge]], but not if it is a [[settlement]]. * Location subobjects ([[Template:Location subobject]]) which link units or agents to their locations on known dates

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a source mentions an entity which has been positively identified, but does not specify any particular role in the document, such as author or addressee.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date on which a [[will (registered copy)|proved will]] was originally made. This can be the same as [[Property:Signed on date]] for the original will, but it is useful to record it as a property of the registered copy because:
* the date made is always stated in the registered copy. * it can be difficult to create a separate page to represent original wills in [[TNA, PROB 10]] because they are not as well catalogued or easy to reference as the registered copies in [[TNA, PROB 11]], and it is not always certain that the original still survives unless it has been found. * a nuncupative will is only recorded in the probate register and does not have a written original.

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Property:Possibly relates to]] to [[Property:Possibly mentions]]: renamed to better reflect how it's now used
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used when an entity mentioned in a source can't be positively identified but there are one or more possibilities.

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Property:Possible same as]] to [[Property:Possibly same as]] without leaving a redirect: typo when created
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that an entity that has a page on this wiki could be the same thing as another entity that has a page on this wiki, but we're not certain enough to merge the pages.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the person who printed an early edition of a book or serial.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date when a will was proved by a probate court. It is only used by instances of [[will (registered copy)]] and not by any other type of manuscript text. The date of probate is not assumed to be the earliest date when the registered copy existed.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used to link:
* journal articles to the journal they were published in * serial volumes to the serial they were published in * chapters to the edited collection they were published in

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the publisher of a [[book (minor edition)]].
It is only used in extra properties for printed sources published in the mid-17th century.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is a parent property used to query for sources that are related to an entity in any way. It is not displayed directly in entity pages or added directly in forms. Instead it is silently added by templates, with the same values that are used in any of these properties:
* [[Property:Addressed to]] * [[Property:Created by]] * [[Property:Has author]] * [[Property:Has editor]] * [[Property:Mentions]] * [[Property:Possibly mentions]] * [[Property:Printed by]] * [[Property:Published by]] * [[Property:Signed by]] * [[Property:To be sold at]] * [[Property:To be sold by]]
This creates a hierarchy similar to subproperties but makes it easier to display property values in query results.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents a person who put an original signature, initials, mark, or seal on a manuscript text. It should only be used if the manuscript contains original signs. If the manuscript is a copy that does not contain the original signs, the value for this property should be [[None]]. If a later copy has a signed certificate of authenticity written on the same paper, the certificate should be represented as a separate child text. If the original of the copy does not survive, you can create a [[Form:Lost manuscript text|Lost manuscript text]] and enter the signatories there.
We do not distinguish between signatures, initials, and marks because the boundaries between these things can be hard to define, and because Signs of Literacy is already collecting data about literacy.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date on which a manuscript document, such as a letter or warrant, was signed. It should only be used if an original signature is present on that particular copy. For later copies that do not have the original signature, this should be left blank. If a later copy has a signed certificate of authenticity written on the same paper, the certificate should be represented as a separate child text. If the original of the copy does not survive, you can create a [[Form:Lost manuscript text|Lost manuscript text]] and enter the date signed there.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] starts. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the address where an early edition of a book or serial was to be sold. An address should only be added to this property if it is given on the title page of the edition in question, otherwise the value should be [[None]]. This property is only used for editions published in the mid-17th century.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the bookseller who was to sell an early edition of a book or serial. A person should only be added to this property if they are named on the title page of the edition in question, otherwise the value should be [[None]]. This property is only used for editions published in the mid-17th century.

This is the "Address" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Address}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Addresses]]. __NOTOC__ = Structured data = {{{for template|Address}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Could be same as: | {{{field|Possibly same as|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Addresses}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Address types}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Geonames ID: | {{{field|Geonames ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Ordnance Survey ID: | {{{field|Ordnance Survey ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Relative address: | {{{field|Address|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Addresses|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! WGS84 Coordinates: | [[#Coordinates|Use map below]] |- ! Categories: | {{{field|Categories|values from namespace=Category|list|delimiter=;|size=35|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. == Copyright acknowledgements == Check the boxes for any of the following that apply: {{{field|OSGB OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from the Ordnance Survey of Great Britain © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|NRS OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from National Records of Scotland © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|OSNI OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from the Ordnance Survey of Northern Ireland © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|WLC OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from the Welsh Language Commissioner (Comisiynydd y Gymraeg) © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|OSI|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from Ordnance Survey Ireland. © Ordnance Survey Ireland. Free to use under [http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0 Creative Commons Attribution Licence 4.0] (CC-BY). == Coordinates == You can use the map below to add or change the coordinates for this place. Just zoom the map in to the right area and double click on the map. The coordinates of the point where you double click will be recorded in the box. You can also manually edit the coordinates in the box or paste in coordinates from somewhere else. {{{field|Coordinates|input type=leaflet}}} = Parent units = {{{field|Parent units|holds template}}} {{{end template}}} {{{for template|Command relationship subobject|embed in field=Address[Parent units]|multiple|add button text=Add parent}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent: | {{{field|Parent unit|input type=tokens|values from category=Autocomplete parent organizations|property=Has parent|list|delimiter=;|size=45}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Relationship type|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Command relationship types|list|delimiter=;|property=Has role|size=45}}} |- ! From: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}}{{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! To: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}}{{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources: | {{{field|Command ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}} |} {{{end template}}} = Personnel = Queries for linked personnel should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add free text if necessary. {{{section|Personnel|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above. If the number of personnel is likely to be more than about 20, use this code to create a link to a query for all linked personnel: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Personnel relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 0
| searchlabel = All linked residents
}}
If the number of personnel is likely to be less than about 20, use this code to display the query results in the page: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Personnel relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 20
| default=No residents found.
}}
In either case, it's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Sources = Queries for linked sources should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add links to external and internal sources. {{{section|Sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above to create a link to a query for all linked sources: 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 10
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
It's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Any other info = {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

In either case, it's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Sources = Queries for linked sources should be added here manually. You can also manually add links to external and internal sources. {{{section|Sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above to create a link to a query for all linked sources:

This is the "Edition (article)" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Article}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Articles]]. __NOTOC__ {{{for template|Article}}} = Work = Work level is represented by: {{{field|Is work|values=This page,Another page|input type=dropdown|show on select=This page=>work-this;Another page=>work-other}}} * choose 'This page' if the work only has one version which is an article * choose 'Another page' if the work has more than one version (including books, articles and manuscripts)
Work level will be represented by this page. You don't need to enter any data about the work here.
{| class="formtable" |- ! Link to parent work(s): | {{{field|Parent work|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|values from category=Works|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |}
= Article = [[#Subjects and dates|Skip to subjects and dates]] {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Title: | {{{field|Title|cols=45|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Author: | {{{field|Author|values from category=Autocomplete creators |list|delimiter=;|size=35|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Editor: | {{{field|Editor|values from category=Autocomplete editors|list|delimiter=;|size=35|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! In journal or collection: | {{{field|Journal|values from category=Autocomplete article parents|input type=text with autocomplete}}} |- ! Year: | {{{field|Year|input type=text|maxlength=4|placeholder=YYYY}}} |- ! Volume: | {{{field|Volume|input type=text}}} |- ! Issue: | {{{field|Issue|input type=text}}} |- ! Start page: | {{{field|Start page|input type=text}}} |- ! End page: | {{{field|End page|input type=text}}} |- ! DOI: | {{{field|DOI|input type=text}}} |- ! URL: | {{{field|URL|size=35|input type=text}}} |- ! JSTOR ID: | {{{field|JSTOR|input type=text}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |} === Copyright === {| class="formtable" |- ! Copyright: | {{{field|Copyright|input type=dropdown|values from category=Copyright status}}} |- ! This is the "Book" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Book}} __NOTOC__ {{{for template|Book}}} = Basic data = {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} = Work = This book's parent work is represented by: {{{field|Is work|values=This page,Another page,No page|input type=dropdown|show on select=This page=>work-this;Another page=>work-other}}} * choose 'This page' if the work only has one version which is a book. You can then enter a Wikidata ID in the field that appears. * choose 'Another page' if the work has more than one version (including books, articles and manuscripts). You can then select the page name that represents the parent work in the field that appears. * choose 'No page' if this is an issue of a serial publication such as a weekly newsbook. You don't need to enter any data about work level here but please make sure that 'In series' (on the 'Major edition' tab) has a value.
{| class="formtable" |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |}
{| class="formtable" |- ! Link to parent work(s): | {{{field|Parent work|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|values from category=Works|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |}
= Major edition = Major edition level is represented by: {{{field|Is maj ed|values=This page,Another page|input type=dropdown|show on select=This page=>maj-this;Another page=>maj-other}}}
{| class="formtable"|- ! Authors: | {{{field|Authors|values from category=Autocomplete creators |list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Editors: | {{{field|Editors|values from category=Autocomplete editors|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Title: | {{{field|Title|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! In series: | {{{field|Series|input type=tokens|values from category=Serial publications|list|delimiter=;|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Volume in series: | {{{field|Volumes|list|delimiter=;|size=20|input type=text}}} |- ! Issue in series: | {{{field|Issue|size=10|input type=text}}} |} === Copyright === {| class="formtable" |- ! Copyright status: | {{{field|Copyright status|input type=dropdown|values from category=Copyright status}}} |- ! Licence: | {{{field|Licence|input type=dropdown|values from category=Licence conditions}}} |- ! Copyright explanation: | {{{field|Copyright explanation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |} === Subjects and dates === {| class="formtable" |- ! Main subject: | {{{field|Main subject|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Autocomplete subjects|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Earliest date covered: | {{{field|Earliest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Latest date covered: | {{{field|Latest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Categories: | {{{field|Categories|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from namespace=Category|list|delimiter=;}}} |} == Contents == {{{field|Query for contents|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box if this book is an edited collection. This will add a query for chapters.
{| class="formtable" |- ! Parent edition: | {{{field|Parent edition|values from category=Books (major editions)|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |}
= Minor edition = Minor edition level is represented by: {{{field|Is min ed|values=This page,Other pages|input type=dropdown|show on select=This page=>min-this;Other pages=>min-other}}}
{| class="formtable" |- ! Publication year: | {{{field|Publication year|input type=text|maxlength=4|placeholder=YYYY}}} |- ! External ID type: | {{{field|Ext ID type|input type=dropdown|values=unknown ID,ISBN,ESTC number,USTC number,BNB ID,BL UIN|default=unknown ID}}} |- ! External ID: | {{{field|Ext ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Publisher's website: | {{{field|URL|input type=text}}} |- ! ASIN: | {{{field|ASIN|input type=text|maxlength=10}}} |} === Open access scans === {{{field|OA scan|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box if this page contains a link to page scans of this whole book that are free and legal to view online without registration or login. === 17th-century editions === {{{field|Early edition|input type=checkbox|show on select=earlyeds}}} Tick this box if the edition was published between about 1639 and 1660. This will display fields for extra data.
{| class="formtable" |- ! Publisher: | {{{field|Publisher|values from category=People|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Publication place: | {{{field|Publication place|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|values from category=Settlements|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Printer: | {{{field|Printer|values from category=People|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! To be sold by: | {{{field|Bookseller|values from category=People|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! To be sold at: | {{{field|Sold at|values from category=Addresses|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |}
=== Query for copies === {{{field|Query for copies|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for individual copies of this edition that have pages on this site. You should only add the query if you know that these already exist or you expect them to exist soon. === Find copies elsewhere === You can use this text area to manually create links to online versions of this edition, or copies available for sale from online retailers. Links to the publisher's website and Amazon will be added automatically if the relevant fields have been filled in above. {{{field|Copies elsewhere|input type=textarea|rows=10}}}
A query for child minor edition pages will be added automatically.
{{{end template}}} = Any other information = {{{section|Any other information|level=2|hide if empty|rows=20}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

This is the "Event" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Event}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Events]]. You can also see [[combat event]]s on a map at [[map of combat events]]. __NOTOC__ {{{for template|Event}}} = Structured data = == Basic data == {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Event types}}} |- ! Location: | {{{field|Location|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Addresses|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! WGS84 coordinates: | [[#Coordinates|Use map below]] (only for combat events) |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Categories: | {{{field|Categories|list|delimiter=;|values from namespace=Category|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. == Dates == This event happened on: {{{field|Days|values=one day,multiple days|input type=dropdown|show on select=one day=>one-day;multiple days=>mult-days}}}
Enter the date of this event below {| class="formtable" |- ! Date: | {{{field|Single date|input type=text|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL|size=13|maxlength=13}}} |}
Enter the start and end date below, and use the dropdown lists to select whether the date is definite or the earliest/latest known: {| class="formtable" |- | {{{field|Start date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite start date,earliest known date|default=definite start date}}} | {{{field|Start date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- | {{{field|End date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite end date,latest known date|default=definite end date}}} | {{{field|End date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |}
== Result == If this was a combat event which was wholly the capture, or attempted capture, of a building or settlement, please enter the result here. Otherwise leave blank. {{{field|Result|input type=dropdown|values from category=Siege results}}} == Related events == {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent event: | {{{field|Parent|values from category=Events|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |} {{{field|Query for child events|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for events that were part of this event. You should only add the query if you know that this event has child events. == Coordinates == You can use the map below to add or change the coordinates for this event if it is a combat event (leave blank for other types of event). Just zoom the map in to the right area and double click on the map. The coordinates of the point where you double click will be recorded in the box. (You can't manually edit the coordinates in the box or paste in coordinates from somewhere else because this feature isn't working properly.) {{{field|Coordinates|input type=leaflet}}} {{{end template}}} =Sources= Queries for linked sources should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add links to external and internal sources. {{{section|Sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above to create a link to a query for all linked sources: 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 10
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
It's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. =Any other info= {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

Mentions: | {{{field|Mentions|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Autocomplete subjects|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |} {{{end template}}} = Published versions = You can use this free text area to link to any other versions of this manuscript that have been published online or in print. {{{section|Published versions|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Any other information = You can use this free text area to add any introductory text, such as information about the provenance or context of the manuscript, or any other relevant information that doesn't fit in other fields. {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Transcript = If copyright and licence conditions allow, you can use this free text area to add a transcript, summary or extracts of the text. Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} == Archival references == {| class="formtable" |- ! Catalogue record URL: | {{{field|Catalogue record URL|input type=text}}} |- ! In GLAM: | {{{field|In GLAM|values from category=GLAMs|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Citable reference: | {{{field|Citable reference|input type=text}}} |- ! Orderable reference: | {{{field|Orderable reference|input type=text}}} |} == Copyright == {| class="formtable" |- ! Copyright status of text: | {{{field|Copyright status|values from category=Copyright status|input type=dropdown}}} |- ! Licence conditions of text: | {{{field|Licence conditions|values from category=Licence conditions|input type=dropdown}}} |- ! Copyright explanation: | {{{field|Copyright explanation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |} === Copyright acknowledgements === Check the box if the following applies: {{{field|Discovery OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from [https://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/ The National Archives' Discovery catalogue]. © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence v3.0] (OGL). == Dates == {| class="formtable" |- ! Earliest date of existence: | {{{field|Earliest existence|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Date signed: | {{{field|Signed|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! In that case, all other dates should be left blank. == Related entities == {| class="formtable" |- ! Created by: | {{{field|Created by|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Autocomplete creators|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! <noinclude>This is a search form which uses the [[Special:RunQuery/Search events by date|run query]] page. This form is not used to create or edit pages.

This form lets you search for events (such as [[combat event]]s or [[meeting]]s) by the dates when they happened.

{{#queryformlink:form=Search events by date|link text=Show query form.}}</noinclude>
<includeonly>This form lets you search for events (such as [[combat event]]s or [[meeting]]s) by the dates when they happened.

You can enter a single date to find events that were in progress on that date, or you can enter two dates to find events that happened on any days within the range.

See [[Help:Dates]] for more information about how to enter dates.

Enter a single date, or the first date of a range in this box:

{{{for template|Search events by date}}}

{{{field|FromDate|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL|mandatory}}}

Optionally, if you want to search for a range of dates, enter the last date in this box (to search for a single date, leave this box blank):

{{{field|ToDate|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}}

Optionally, you can limit the search to one type of event by selecting it from the list below (leave this blank to search for all types of event):

{{{field|EventType|input type=dropdown|values from category=Event types}}}

{{{end template}}}

{{{standard input|summary}}}

revision.text:
<noinclude>
This is the "Type definition" form.
To create a page with this form, enter the page name below;
if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page.

This form is used to create and edit pages that define an entity type or class.

{{#forminput:form=Type definition}}

All pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Type definitions]].

</noinclude><includeonly>
{{{for template|Type definition}}}
{| class="formtable"
|-
! Wikidata ID: 
| {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}}
|}

To make this page available as a value in the relevant form field, please add it to one of these categories:
 
{{{field|Category|input type=dropdown|values=Address types,Area types,Event types,Manuscript text types,Species,Unit types}}}


{{{end template}}}

You can use this text area to write a human-readable definition of this type definition:

{{{standard input|free text|rows=20}}}


{{{standard input|summary}}}

{{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}}

{{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}
</includeonly>

This is the "Unit" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Unit}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Units]]. __NOTOC__ = Structured data = {{{for template|Unit}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Could be same as: | {{{field|Possibly same as|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Unit type: | {{{field|Unit type|input type=combobox|values from category=Unit types}}} |- ! Start date: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}} {{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources for start date: | {{{field|Earliest date ref|input type=textarea|rows=3|cols=45}}} |- ! End date: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}} {{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources for end date: | {{{field|Latest date ref|input type=textarea|rows=3|cols=45}}} |- ! Categories: | {{{field|Categories|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from namespace=Category|list|delimiter=;}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. Link to this page instead of displaying a map in the page (this can be used in future if the map gets too big): {{{field|MapPage|input type=text|size=40}}} = Parent units = {{{field|Parent units|holds template}}} {{{end template}}} {{{for template|Command relationship subobject|embed in field=Unit[Parent units]|multiple|add button text=Add parent}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent: | {{{field|Parent unit|input type=tokens|values from category=Autocomplete parent organizations|property=Has parent|list|delimiter=;|size=45}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Relationship type|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Command relationship types|list|delimiter=;|property=Has role|size=45}}} |- ! From: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}}{{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! To: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}}{{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources: | {{{field|Command ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}} |} {{{end template}}} = Subordinates = Queries for linked subordinates should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add free text if necessary. If this unit is a household or a ship, it won't normally have subordinate units so this box should be left blank. Many troop/company level military units won't have subordinates, but some will be occupiers of settlements or buildings. {{{section|Subordinates|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above. If the number of subordinates is likely to be more than 20, use this code to create a link to a query for all linked subordinates: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Command relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 0
| searchlabel = All linked subordinates
}}
If the number of subordinates is likely to be less than 20, use this code to display the query results in the page: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Command relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 20
| default=No subordinates found.
}}
In either case, it's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Personnel = Queries for linked personnel should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add free text if necessary. {{{section|Personnel|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above. If the number of personnel is likely to be more than about 20, use this code to create a link to a query for all linked personnel: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Personnel relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 0
| searchlabel = All linked personnel
}}
If the number of personnel is likely to be less than about 20, use this code to display the query results in the page: 
{{#ask:
[[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Is instance of::Personnel relationship]]
| ?Has subordinate=Name
| ?Has role=Role
| ?Has earliest known date=Earliest
| ?Has latest known date=Latest
| mainlabel=-
| limit = 20
| default=No personnel found.
}}
In either case, it's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Sources = Queries for linked sources should be added here manually. They're not templated because we sometimes need more flexibility. You can also manually add links to external and internal sources. {{{section|Sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} To start with, you can usually copy the following text into the box above to create a link to a query for all linked sources: 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 10
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
It's more efficient if you replace '{{PAGENAME}}' with the actual name of this page, but you don't have to. = Any other info = {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

<noinclude>
This is the "Unit events page" form.

Pages that use this form should usually be created via the red link on the relevant Unit page, but you can also create or edit a page by entering the page name below (it should begin with 'Events:' and then match the name of a Unit page):

{{#forminput:form=Unit events page}}

</noinclude><includeonly>
{{{for template|Unit events page}}}

If there are too many events for one page, you can create subpages by entering their names in this box. You can also create subpages to separate different types of event, for example, one for combat and another for meetings. You should separate multiple values with ;

{{{field|Subpages|list|delimiter=;|input type=text}}}

You can add events to this page here.
 
{{{field|Events|holds template}}}

{{{end template}}}

{{{for template|Unit event subobject|embed in field=Unit events page[Events]|multiple|add button text=Add event}}}
{| class="formtable"
|-
! Event: 
|{{{field|Event|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Events|property=Has event|size=45}}}

|-
! Sources:
|{{{field|Event ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}}
|}
{{{end template}}}


{{{standard input|summary}}}

{{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}}

{{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}
</includeonly>

</includeonly>
